Class Logic

java.lang.Object
Logic
public class Logic extends Object
Class "Logic". Contains all methods to play the game.
Author:
Cailean Bernard.

  • Field Details

    • random

      private SecureRandom random
      SecureRandom object for generating random number used as Computer's choice.

    • playerChoice

      private int playerChoice
      Player's choice. 0 = rock, 1 = paper, 2 = scissors.

    • computerChoice

      private int computerChoice
      Computer's choice. Randomly generated integer between 0 and 2 inclusive.

    • playerScore

      private int playerScore
      Player's score. First to 2 wins.

    • playerInput

      private String playerInput
      String representation of player's input.

    • computerScore

      private int computerScore
      Computer's score. First to 2 wins.

  • Constructor Details

    • Logic

      public Logic()

  • Method Details

    • mainMenu

      public void mainMenu()
      Displays an introductory menu explaining the rules and win condition of the game.

    • getCompChoice

      public int getCompChoice()
      Randomly generates an integer between 0 and 2 inclusive to represent the computer's choice
      Returns:
      int - The generated integer representing computer's choice.

    • getPlayerChoice

      public int getPlayerChoice(Scanner userIn)
      Gets the player's choice via user input (keyboard). Filters out all input that is not "r", "p", or "s" ignoring capitalization.
      Parameters:
      userIn - - Scanner object to accept input via keyboard.
      Returns:
      int - The integer representation of the player's choice.

    • playRound

      public void playRound(Scanner userIn)
      Plays one round of the game. Gets the player's choice, then the computer's choice, then checks if the round resulted in a tie. If it didn't, checks if the player won. If they didn't, the computer wins the round. The winner of the round has their score incremented.
      Parameters:
      userIn - - Scanner object to accept input via keyboard.

    • playGame

      public void playGame(Scanner userIn)
      Plays the game while neither player has two points. Starts by printing the main menu with rules, then plays rounds until there is a winner. After one of either the player or the computer has 2 points, the method checks who won.
      Parameters:
      userIn - - Scanner object to accept input via keyboard.

    • playAgain

      public boolean playAgain(Scanner userIn)
      Method to play another game. Re-runs the game if the player enters y, or exits if the user enters n.
      Parameters:
      userIn - - Gets input from user via keyboard.
      Returns:
      boolean - Plays the game again if true, exits the program if false.
